@@ -0,0 +1,36 @@

+
+package op
+
+import tf "github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tensorflow/go"
+
+// Gradients adds gradients computation ops to the graph according to scope.
+//
+// Arguments:
+//  y: output of the function to derive
+//  x: inputs of the function for which partial derivatives are computed
+//  dx: if not null, the partial derivatives of some loss function L w.r.t. y
+//
+//  return the partial derivatives
+func Gradients(scope *Scope, y []tf.Output, x []tf.Output, dx ...tf.Output) (output []tf.Output) {
+	var err error
+	if output, err = scope.graph.AddGradients(scope.opName(scope.uniqueName("Gradients")), y, x, dx); err != nil {
body:
In fact, [the implementation of C](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/94ab1a9e82fb7630b1aae44984d73968508dc917/tensorflow/c/c_api.cc#L2441-L2447) uses [the api about scope in C++](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/94ab1a9e82fb7630b1aae44984d73968508dc917/tensorflow/cc/framework/gradients.h#L30-L35).

And the scope of C++ also have [device](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/94ab1a9e82fb7630b1aae44984d73968508dc917/tensorflow/cc/framework/scope.h#L132-L134) and [controlDepandencies](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/94ab1a9e82fb7630b1aae44984d73968508dc917/tensorflow/cc/framework/scope.h#L119-L126)
But the implementation of  gradient don't handle them.

I'm not sure if it is right to implement it with different logic in C++(when we finally call the implementation in C++).

Of course, if we still think it it more important to be consistent with other op in go or there are other details that I didn't find, I'm also willing to just lead to an error in the code now.
@asimshankar
body_html:
In fact, the implementation of C uses the api about scope in C++.

And the scope of C++ also have device and controlDepandencies
But the implementation of gradient don't handle them.

I'm not sure if it is right to implement it with different logic in C++(when we finally call the implementation in C++).

Of course, if we still think it it more important to be consistent with other op in go or there are other details that I didn't find, I'm also willing to just lead to an error in the code now.
@asimshankar
body_text:
In fact, the implementation of C uses the api about scope in C++.
And the scope of C++ also have device and controlDepandencies
But the implementation of  gradient don't handle them.
I'm not sure if it is right to implement it with different logic in C++(when we finally call the implementation in C++).
Of course, if we still think it it more important to be consistent with other op in go or there are other details that I didn't find, I'm also willing to just lead to an error in the code now.
@asimshankar
